description.narrative: Bhutan had a strict conservation approach towards its forest, which covers more than 60% of its very mountainous landscape. The forest has been very well preserved but is under increasing pressure. SDC, through Helvetas, supports since 2002 a pilot project for the creation and support of some community forestry management groups. Until today, 42 communities have been awarded a 10 years (renewable) property title, accompanied by an agreed management plan for their neighboring forest. This next 5-year phase of the project will be the final phase of support. It should enable to upscale community forestry to an additional 200 communities nationwide and provide the necessary institutional and human resource training support to allow the government to continue with its own funds. The strengthening of capacities at the local level will be an important part of the project. Some economical benefits should be generated by the participating communities. The Royal Government of Bhutan is very committed and has allocated about 3.5 times the funds available through the project. Helvetas will provide an international technical assistant. The implementation will be done entirely through the Royal Government of Bhutan.
